intro: Micromeria echioides var. angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf desert star, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northwestern Mexico. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and umbellate inflorescences. The plant has narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, and its small, white to pale yellow flowers bloom in spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to hot, dry climates with minimal water requirements. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in xeriscapes and native plant gardens.
